oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Baptist Church Alamo: fieldnotes
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: West, Carroll Van
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Fieldnotes on First Baptist Church of Alamo. Notes document the location of the church and provide a brief sketch of the church.

The First Baptist Church of Alamo, Tennessee is a rural African American church. The historic building was remodeled in 1976 under the pastorate of Reverend E. L. Mabins. On November 4, 1984, the church cornerstone was laid by Celestial Lodge No. 80 of Humboldt, Tennessee. Reverend John Cole served as pastor at that time. The Central High School once stood behind the building. At the time of fieldwork, a park had replaced the former high school.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: African American Churches -- Tennessee
